OrgName: EasyLink Services International Corporation, including its US based affiliates and subsidiary corporations
activities:
Personal Information Received from the EU/EEA and/or Switzerland:
EasyLink will provide privacy protection as described in the Safe Harbor Privacy Principles to Personal Data transmitted to Easylink (and its affiliated and subsidiary corporations including Open Text Inc and Open Text Corporation) by its customers (including customers of its affiliated and subsidiary corporations including Open Text Inc. and Open Text Corporation) from the EU/EEA and/or Switzerland as described herein.  EasyLink as a data controller: 1) On-line data: EasyLink collects personal information through its websites, including without limitation in connection with subscriptions for newsletters, downloads of materials and registration for products and services, etc. EasyLink maintains customer records and performs analysis against its customer records in order to perform various customer services activities. 2) Human Resources data: EasyLink maintains records of current, former and prospective employees to manage and maintain its employee workforce and conduct its business. EasyLink as a data processor: EasyLink may act as processor of personal information received from EU/EEA/and or Switzerland to the U.S. in the following contexts; in each scenario, the customer remains the owner and controller of any personal information that is received: 1) Hosted Software-as-a-Service offerings, 2)  Managed Hosting Services, 3) Managed Services related to Electronic Data Interchange services, 4) Electronic Data Interchange services, 5) Email, Fax, SMS, and Voice messaging services, and 6) Product support services.  EasyLink processes personal information in these offerings at the direction of its customer, which is the data controller and is responsible for providing notices to and obtaining required consents from data subjects. EasyLink does not control this data and any access to or use of such data is incidental to completing its contractual requirements for the customer.
eucountries: Austria, Belgium, Bulgaria, Croatia, Cyprus, Czech Republic, Denmark, Estonia, Finland, France, Germany, Greece, Hungary, Iceland, Ireland, Italy, Latvia, Liechtenstein, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Malta, Netherlands, Norway, Poland, Portugal, Romania, Slovakia, Slovenia, Spain, Sweden, Switzerland, United Kingdom
recoursemech: EU Data Protection Authorities and Swiss Federal Data Protection and Information Commissioner
